Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: malcolmdinko
Reviews.Content: Pretty typical budget hotel. Beds aren't very comfortable, some aches in the morning. Smells musty. Not noisy. Shower is not bad. AC works. No breakfast. They try and nickel and dime you with a $1.50 "safe fee" -- if you don't use the safe you can contest this fee at checkout. Annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Lybdog
Reviews.Content: For a couple of broke college kids on a weekend trip, this was perfect. We noticed the highway noise a bit, but it was nothing we couldn't sleep through. The location is great since its right off the highway and near tons of restaurants nd convenience stores, including both a target and a Walmart.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels with more amenities in this price range.”
Reviews.Author: World_of_Wayne
Reviews.Content: Many of the fixtures and utilities in this hotel need updating. I had a "deluxe" room, with a king bed. The heat/air unit was extremely loud, as was the toilet. The lid to the toilet tank didn't fit properly, and the water pressure in the shower was inconsistent-it kept getting stronger and weaker. Also, the lack of a Wall-mounted hair dryer and an iron was annoying, as most hotels in this price range have them-especially in a pricier "deluxe" room. The front desk staff balked at giving me an itemized receipt. While the location was convenient, there are much better options in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “good typical red roof”
Reviews.Author: 48Traveling
Reviews.Content: The location is right next to a wide open free way. Not a really ideal place for a good nice sleep but it turned out okay. No noise from the freeway to disturb your sleep. The property felt very safe. The wide open view actually made it nice to open the door in the evening to watch the road and fireflies all over the property. The room is a Red Roof standard fare. It is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget motel.”
Reviews.Author: kenferg1
Reviews.Content: I caught a nice sale on a room. When I arrived I was warmly greeted. The registration was quick. The room was clean, the hearing unit was fairly quiet and adjusted to and kept the temperature. The one exception was the bed. There were plenty of pillows but the bed was very hard. If you can get past the bed this is a very nice motel.

Reviews.Title: “Superior rooms are "nicer" but probably not worth the extra cost”
Reviews.Author: shazam10
Reviews.Content: I booked a superior room just out of curiosity to see what its like and whilst it is nice and roomier I don't think it worth paying extra for. I've stayed in the cheaper rooms and the difference isn't too great, I think as a budget motel Red Roof is much better in cleanliness then Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant one night stay in NW Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: Pnemiller
Reviews.Content: We were able to use a Roomsaver coupon for $42 at this place right off the Interstate. We got a quiet room in the rear, away from the main road, There were two beds, 2 pillows each. The lights over the beds were a good touch. No breakfast included, but there is a McDonalds right behind the motels. Free Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: graceisenough
Reviews.Content: Red Roof did a great job of giving me a room on the second floor that was clean, spacious and safe. That is great when you are traveling on your own and in a new town. The hotel was far from empty, but it was quiet - my room was facing the animal hospital. Overall a great experience - the staff was warm and friendly and it was an exceptional value. I found a great rate on a Business King for around $54 a night and the room had a microwave and a small fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: dragracingfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Red Roof Inn for 6 days, from Aug.30, 2011 to Sept. 5, 2011 while I was attending the U.S. Nationals at Lucas Oil Raceway. My room was a Busines King, which included a refrigerator and microwave. The room was spotlessly clean and everything in it worked as it should. My daily rate was $56.15 including all taxes; when you check out just be sure to mention if you didn't use the in room safe and the daily $1.61 charge will be removed from your bill. This motel is located right off of I-465 Exit 27, and is close to many shopping malls, restaurants, and a Walmart Supercenter. The staff were all friendly and courteous, especially Brandon. I travel quite often to attend NHRA National and Divisional events; and Red Roof Inns are my motel of choice because I have never had a bad experience at any of them.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Annual Stay and Will Do It Again in 2012”
Reviews.Author: Angie B
Reviews.Content: Each year we stay in Indianapolis for the Gasoline Rally Scooter Rally. We stayed at Red Roof in 2010 and enjoyed it so much we booked for 2011. This year we had 11 people book a 4-day weekend and there were no negative comments about the Inn the entire stay. We were assisted by the Manager upon Check-In. It helped we had our Confirmation printed in advance to confirm the room rates. Red Roof offers a "Green" program and we utilized this; no room service was required in our room and that was perfectly satisfactory. One of our friends had a broken desk chair and it was quickly replaced with a new one. Other than the chair, we had great rooms, great service and we look forward to spending next year at this same Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay, Clean, Great Value..just double check your bill...”
Reviews.Author: psupiller
Reviews.Content: A very good value in Indy...basic but clean, friendly staff, close to a lot of restaurants, right off of I-465. Close to many destinations such as Indianapolis Motor Speedway, Raceway Park or the State Fairgrounds. My only problem was with overcharges...use of the in-room safe was automatically charged for each day. These were resolved upon checkout, but after I got home I discovered I was overcharged for one of my nights. With one email I had a response from management, who refunded the difference plus $10. Overall, a very nice, basic place, nice bed and clean all-around for a very fair price. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget motel”
Reviews.Author: MrsM2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on an over-night trip for cheaper business accommodations. Rooms were pretty clean; the carpet had some paint stains, but nothing too noticeable. If traveling for work or planning on spending considerable amount of time a room, the desks that they had in the room were great. The bathroom was clean and the shower had plenty of hot water. My only real complaint was the bed. It was like sleeping on springs. Would suggest for a decent, clean, and safe place to sleep for the night.

Reviews.Title: “What do you need in a hotel?????? it makes a different for the review!”
Reviews.Author: Flashpoint1
Reviews.Content: If you need a place to stay, that is acceptable, clean, and cheap, This is your hotel! Other than the very unhelpful front desk staff, the hotel is perfectly acceptable should you need somewhere to just to sleep. No the beds aren't amazing, no the furnishings are spectacular but it was $35 per night. I think it is a bargain for $35.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: travellevret
Reviews.Content: This is a remodeled, Red Roof motel and seems to be pretty standard for the chain. The rooms are clean and bright. Not many amenities, but actually more stylish than a lot of hotels. Wireless internet worked well. The regular King room is quite tiny, however. The double rooms and King suite are bigger, and you pay extra for the King suite. I didn't find the service to be awesome, but was certainly fine. I didn't notice much noise from the highway. This is a fine place to stay for a very clean room with wifi. It might even be fine for some people who think a budget motel could never meet their standards,so long as you make sure you don't need a service the motel does not provide.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: judijenkins
Reviews.Content: The staff is the best of all the hotels I stay at, I travel alot for buisness and always have a great stay,the rooms are clean & the beds or comfy. Great value for any traveler. Judi

Reviews.Title: “awesome place”
Reviews.Author: janetmc3
Reviews.Content: what a great place to stay! everyone at the desk was so friendly and the room was clean. We enjoyed our stay. Carol at the desk was able to suggest a good place to eat for dinner and the night clerk Vail brought us extra towels when we asked for them. Price for just right for a family on a budget. We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Red Roof Inn always exceeds my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: ABIGAILColumbus_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Red Roof Inn always exceeds my expectations. They keep the hotel extremely clean and neat even during really bad winter weather. When I check in, they are very polite and welcome me back by name (I frequently stay at Red Roof Inns). The rooms are always the correct temperture (warm in the winter and cool in the summer) when I arrive so I can immediately begin to relax. I also really enjoy getting a USA Today newspaper each day from Red Roof Inn. When it's time for me to checkout, Red Roof Inn processes my paperwork ASAP which allows me to get on my way for business meetings. Overall, Red Roof Inn just does a terrific job and it remains my first choice in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Will book my room there when staying in Indianapolis.”
Reviews.Author: racingrl17
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Staff is very friendly and welcomes you. Room was very clean and quite. Would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Indianapolis area.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN !!!! VERY EASY TO FIND !”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl09michigan
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this hotel...super friendly, super clean, everything was brand new in the room and traveling from out of town the front desk was very helpful with directions. The lighting in the room was great for reading at the desk and reading notes in bed prior to falling asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy, quiet...”
Reviews.Author: scottnjules
Reviews.Content: After being on the road for the past 3 weeks we have some hits and some misses with accommodation. This place was clean, the bed was comfy, the area was nice and quiet.. no frills but thats not a problem when you just need a nice bed for the night. Very happy with this stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: flutterby81
Reviews.Content: if you're looking for a cheap and clean hotel in Indy, this one is a good one. There was not much at the hotel but if you're planning to be out and doing things in Indy, it shouldn't matter too much. It is in a good part of town and is very close to the interstate, which means you can get to things pretty quickly. It's about 15 minutes from downtown. I was surprised by this hotel. It looks like it has just been remodled. The room was a pretty small hotel room, but it was extemely clean. I usually stay in condos and resorts and hate staying at hotels, however this is probably the cleanest hotel I've been in. The carpets, bedding and furniture all looked very new. We did not spend much time there, so we did not check on how the electronics worked. I would not have wanted to spend much time in the room anyway because of the size. The staff was friendly when we checked in and out. I did not see any complementary breakfast, but I'm not sure if there was even supposed to be any. The hotel was close to the interstate but I didn't have any trouble with the extra noise.

Reviews.Title: “definitely wait for necessary renos”
Reviews.Author: cowtownCalgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for Grand Prix, June 14-18. Good: -Check-in desk staff are really accomodating (except for the one girl that couldn't be bothered to tell us where there was another ice machine, as the one near us was constantly running out as everybody was filling up for Grand Prix). -coffee machine at the front desk. Bad -Room: - Ours was a dump. Very small, double bed that the one side table an inch away from the bed does touch the wall. Small bureau for clothes, clothes rack to hang items, small table and 1 chair. We finally figured out why our feet were always filthy -- the rugs are absolutely full of dirt. -On the size. When we checked out we were shown the layout and saw that our room was about 2/3 size of other rooms, and yet same price. That is not nice. Told that we should book directly with them vs over internet as can then ask for specific rooms - business room only as that is the larger size, and goes for the same rate as the smaller one. -One morning while getting coffee I overheard someone checking out compaining about the value they didn't feel they got from the room; frankly at $40 I thought it was an ok price. Without much trouble they gave her a 15% discount. So..... when we checked out and were asked how our stay was, I told them it wasn't great. They asked why -- all about the room being a dump and dirty. They did say they were due for renos in November, but that they had been promised renos for quite awhile now. After a good 5 minute discussion wherein we said we wouldn't stay there again as were quite disappointed with the room we were asked if anything could be done. I figured we would ask for 1 free night - our last night as we had to pay ~$100 for fri-sun as was race-high weekend. that was given without any hesitation -- they may be too used to having to give this out as more than just our room may be a dump. Were also asked if that was "good enough" - now lets not get crazy, as that starts bordering on greed to us. If there is a next time, we will contact the hotel directly and find out if the promised Nov renos have been done. If not, we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “staff & rooms amazing”
Reviews.Author: ParagonFireman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful for still being a classic red roof inn. The value is not pricey at all and I have never had any trouble with cleanliness issues. I'm not sure about the last review as there is not an elevator at this inn at 96th and Michigan rd. The manager, Vickie Lam, is exceptional and always "on her toes" to please each and every customer. The front desk is quick & helpful with checking in & out and satisfying customer's needs in the late hours. Once I had checked in really late and I had an important meeting early the next morning. I asked the girl at the desk where the nearest drycleaners was, b/c one of the buttons had snapped off my suitcoat. She amazed me and said she was not busy and offered to sew the button back on! I took her up on it! Nice job as well with the steady cleaning. Maidservice staff seems long lasting, which means my rooms will be consistently clean. Maintenance is also very helpful and very quick and efficient for repairing things in a timely manner. Upkeep at this location is up to par for a classic inn. I have always enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “dirty dirty”
Reviews.Author: anbt1025
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 other guests recently stayed in this hotel while in Indianapolis for the Brickyard race. The staff at the front counter was very friendly and executed tasks in a timely manner. Sadly, that is the only positive thing there is to say about this hotel. The elevator had wires hanging from the ceiling, we opted for the stairs. The room had huge cobwebs in the corners that appeared to be there for so long they had actually collected dirt. There was molded food (cheese is what we decided on) in the air vents of the air conditioner unit, potato chips and french fries visibly on the floor and the bathroom tub was in need of a good scrubbing. The "cable" television allowed clear viewing of maybe three stations. The bed sheets in the "non smoking" room had burn holes in them and I chose to sleep on top of the sheets after the other two guests were constantly being bitten by bugs beneath the sheets. Needless to say, we didn't try the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Bad news”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived Monday, March 3rd because my brother was having Hi-risk Heart Surgery March 4th. When we arrived to check in, the manager handed us a business card with my nieces name on it and told us we were to call her. We proceeded to check in and I called her right away. Well it turns out that they bumped his surgery to Friday. And so there we were checked into the hotel for nothing. We had paid for two rooms. So my husband went and checked us out and we started our 4 hour journey back home. When talking to my brother and niece a little bit later, it seems she had told them to tell us to call before we checked in. The people at the check-in didn't tell us that message though. They just handed us the card and said to call her. So we weren't told to call before checking in as she had told them to tell us. I really feel Red Roof owes us our money back because they didn't tell us the right message. I feel it was on purpose. Because when we checked in we also asked if we could have two rooms side by side and they got mouthy and said if we'd have told them that before our arrival we could've. Well I did. In fact I called Friday afternoon, on Feb 28th and the young boy told me we had to wait until we got there. The whole experience at that Red Roof was unpleasant in the short time we were there. But I feel they should give us our money back since they didn't tell us to call my niece before checking in. And I will not forget this. I will never stay at another Red Roof Inn as long as I live. The manager or whoever he was, was hateful the whole time. Prob'ly because I told him he needed to put some salt on the ice on the sidewalk 'cause it was very slippery.

HotelInfo.Name: Red Roof Inn Indianapolis North - College Park
HotelInfo.Address: 9520 Valparaiso Ct, Indianapolis, IN 46268
